name: Shrimp Quesadillas with Cilantro and Lime
author: Dbisbill
summary: These shrimp quesadillas are perfect as a lunch, dinner, or snack. What a great way to use up fresh herbs and serve up a wholesome treat!
ingredients: ¼ (16 ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained and minced
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste
8  large shrimp - peeled, deveined, and chopped into bite-sized pieces
½ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend
directions: Combine roasted red peppers, cilantro, lime juice, and chili powder in a shallow dish
Toss chopped shrimp in the lime mixture
Meanwhile, heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil
Saute onion in the hot oil until tender and translucent, about 5 minutes
Add shrimp and lime mixture and saute until shrimp are pink and cooked through, about 3 minutes
Assemble quesadillas by placing shrimp mixture and Mexican cheese in between 2 tortillas
Heat tortillas in the skillet over medium-low heat until cheese is melted and tortillas are crispy, 3 to 4 minutes
Cut quesadillas into bite-sized segments and serve
